moves.1. d4: So here's a game where white manages to promote a pawn tol a queen on move 27, while queens are still on the board. So here's how it went down.
moves.3. Nc3 c6 4. a4 e6 5. Nf3 Bb4 6. Bd2 a5: Till here it had been rather normal, but this move was odd.
moves.7. e3 Nh6: Developed the knight on the rim? Aren't knights on the rim dim?
moves.8. Bxc4 O-O 9. O-O Bxc3: Black volunteers to give away the dark square bishop for a knight.
moves.10. Bxc3 Bd7 11. b4 b6 12. Ne5: Hitting the bishop, and a nice outpost for the knight.
moves.12... Be8 13. Qf3 Nd7: This was odd because he just gave me the pawn on c6, with tempo.
moves.14. Nxc6 Qh4 15. h3: i made this move to prevent any possible ng4`s
moves.15... Rc8 16. b5 Rc7 17. d5: This was a mistake by me, i didn't pay any attention to the bishop hanging
moves.18. Rfc1 Qh4: This was the only square for the Queen because of the thread of Qg3 threatening mate and attacking the lose rook.
moves.19. d6: Gaining an amazing outpost for the knight on e7.
moves.19... Rb7: This was a blunder allowing white to win the rook for nothing. best would probably have been to play an exchange sacrifice.
moves.21... Nc5 22. Qxb6 Nd3 23. Rcf1: probably the best move in this position
moves.24... g5: This was a mistake , because it weakens the a1-h8 diagonal
moves.25. Qb8: pinning the bishop and preparing to play d7.
moves.25... Ng8 26. d7: Black is in big trouble here.
moves.26... Nf6: this move allows the pawn queening without taking the bishop.
moves.27... Qc5 28. Rad1 Nd7: This was also a mistake, because white can just take it, because bishop is pinned to the rook with a thread of mate.
moves.29. Qxd7 Kg7 30. Qxd3: exchanging knights here, not sure if it was a mistake, but that black Knight on d3 was a real pain.
moves.30... Bxb5: bxb5?? This move seems to attack both ´queens, but white has both queens pointing at this square.
moves.31. Qbxb5: Maybe black should have taken the queen here, but it really doesn't matter, because its been a lost game for long now.
moves.31... Qxe7 32. Bb4: Deflecting the queen away from protecting g5
moves.32... Qe8 33. Qxg5+: Here its a forced mate in fact(Atleast i think so)
moves.36. Qxf6+ Kg8 37. Qdd4 e5: This doesn't stop the wrath of double queens.
moves.38. Qd5+ Qf7 39. Qdxf7#: And its mate. The guy i played against is a true legend for playing till the end <3. Thanks for checking the annotation out.
